citation.article-title: Re-evaluation of the status of the genus Oerskovia, reclassification of Promicromonospora enterophila (Jager et al. 1983) as Oerskovia enterophila comb. nov. and description of Oerskovia jenensis sp. nov. and Oerskovia paurometabola sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of Oerskovia turbata (Prauser et al. 1970)

In addition to the physiological properties given in the original description by Prauser et al. (1970), strains of this species are characterized by the physiological reactions indicated in Tables 4 and 5. Colonies on trypticase/soy/yeast extract agar (medium 92, DSMZ Catalogue of Strains) are lemon yellow and 0.2-0.4 mm in diameter at 28°C after 2 days. The type strain is aerobic to facultatively anaerobic. Peptidoglycan type is L-Lys←L-Thr←D-Asp.
